required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Randomized Study Comparing Two Models of a Travoprost Intraocular Implant to Timolol Maleate Ophthalmic Solution, 0.5%
clinical_study.official_title: Prospective, Randomized Phase III Study Comparing Two Models of a Travoprost Intraocular Implant to Timolol Maleate Ophthalmic Solution, 0.5%

brief_summary.textblock: Phase III study to compare the safety and efficacy of intraocular implants containing travoprost at two different elution rates versus Timolol Maleate Ophthalmic Solution, 0.5% (timolol) in reducing elevated intraocular pressure in subjects with open-angle glaucoma (OAG) or ocular hypertension (OHT).

detailed_description.textblock: This is a prospective, randomized, double-masked, active-controlled, parallel-group, multi-center trial comparing the efficacy and safety of the Model G2TR 063 Travoprost Intraocular Implant and the Model G2TR-125 Travoprost Intraocular Implant to topical timolol in subjects with OAG or OHT. The staff who record key efficacy measures and the study subjects will remain masked to study treatment.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean IOP (Control Group vs. Each Implant Group) through 3 months postoperative
primary_outcome.description: Difference in mean diurnal IOP, between each test group and the control group, for IOP measurements through the Month 3 follow-up visit.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean IOP (Control Group vs. Each Implant Group) through 12 months postoperative
secondary_outcome.description: Difference in mean IOP, between each test group and the control group, for IOP measurements through the Month 12 follow-up visit.

arm_group.description: G2TR intraocular implant containing travoprost 78 mcg with high elution rate, plus postoperative placebo eye drops.
G2TR intraocular implant containing travoprost 78 mcg with low elution rate, plus postoperative placebo eye drops.

intervention.description: Sham surgery plus postoperative active-comparator eye drops (timolol maleate ophthalmic solution, 0.5%).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosed with open-angle glaucoma or ocular hypertension.
- C/D ratio â‰¤ 0.8
- Zero to three preoperative ocular hypotensive medications
Exclusion Criteria:
- Active corneal inflammation or edema.
- Retinal disorders not associated with glaucoma.
